com.samsung.android.sdk.accessory

Class SASocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.accessory.SASocket

  • public abstract class SASocket
extends Object
    This class represents an instance of a Service Connection between a Service Provider and a Service Consumer.

    Developer Guides

    This class represents an active Service Connection between a Service Provider and a Service Consumer. (Both Service Provider and Service Consumer application must declare a subclass of SAAgent). The Service Connection, represented by this class, is the dialogue between the two SAAgent objects.

    The objects of this class are created when a successful Service Connection is established. Both Service Provider and Service Consumer application must declare a subclass of this class, and implement the Service Connection related event handling methods: onReceive(int, byte[]), onError(int, String, int), and onServiceConnectionLost(int). .

    Both Service Provider and Service Consumer application can simply call send(int, byte[]) to write on a channel inside the Service Connection. They can also call close() to terminate the Service Connection with the remote Accessory Peer Agent.

    Both Service Provider and Service Consumer application must register a concrete implementation of this class with SAAgent by passing the name and derived concrete class as the parameters of SAAgent constructor. An instance of this class is passed to the SAAgent object in the SAAgent.onServiceConnectionResponse(SASocket, int) callback, once the Service Connection is established with the Accessory Peer Agent. Your application must also implement the constructor of this class for Java Reflection construction purposes, as follows: 

     YourSubclassExtendsThisClass{
   super("the name of your subclass extends this class"); 
 }

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CONNECTION_LOST_DEVICE_DETACHED
      Connection lost because the Accessory Device was detached.
      static int CONNECTION_LOST_PEER_DISCONNECTED
      Service Connection lost because the remote Accessory Peer Agent closed the Service Connection.
      static int CONNECTION_LOST_RETRANSMISSION_FAILED
      Service Connection lost because it required reliable transfer(retransmission).
      static int CONNECTION_LOST_UNKNOWN_REASON
      Connection lost for reasons Samsung Accessory Service Framework cannot distinguish.
      static int ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED
      Sending data failed because the connection was disconnected.
      static int ERROR_FATAL
      Service Connection lost because of a binding failure with Samsung Accessory Service Framework.

    • Field Detail

      • CONNECTION_LOST_PEER_DISCONNECTED

        public static final int CONNECTION_LOST_PEER_DISCONNECTED
        Service Connection lost because the remote Accessory Peer Agent closed the Service Connection. This is a graceful termination initiated by the remote Accessory Peer Agent. The error code is used by the onServiceConnectionLost(int) callback.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONNECTION_LOST_UNKNOWN_REASON

        public static final int CONNECTION_LOST_UNKNOWN_REASON
        Connection lost for reasons Samsung Accessory Service Framework cannot distinguish. The error code is used by the onServiceConnectionLost(int) callback.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONNECTION_LOST_DEVICE_DETACHED

        public static final int CONNECTION_LOST_DEVICE_DETACHED
        Connection lost because the Accessory Device was detached. The error code is used by the onServiceConnectionLost(int) callback.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONNECTION_LOST_RETRANSMISSION_FAILED

        public static final int CONNECTION_LOST_RETRANSMISSION_FAILED

        Service Connection lost because it required reliable transfer(retransmission). Since all retransmission trials failed, Samsung Accessory Service Framework terminated the Service Connection because it can not meet the reliable transfer requirement.

        The error code is used by the onServiceConnectionLost(int) callback.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_FATAL

        public static final int ERROR_FATAL
        Service Connection lost because of a binding failure with Samsung Accessory Service Framework. This SASocket no longer represents a valid service connection. The error code is used by the onServiceConnectionLost(int) callback.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED

        public static final int ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED
        Sending data failed because the connection was disconnected. This error code is passed in the onError(int, String, int) callback.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getConnectedPeerAgent

        public SAPeerAgent getConnectedPeerAgent()
        Get the SAPeerAgent object which encapsulates the information of the connected remote Accessory Peer Agent and the Accessory Device that the Accessory Peer Agent runs on. For the Accessory Peer Agent, the information includes, for example, the Service Profile specification version that the Accessory Peer Agent follows and the application name. For the Accessory Device, the information includes, for example, vendor ID, product ID, and device name.
        Returns:
        The SAPeerAgent object which encapsulates the information of the connected remote Accessory Peer Agent.

      • send

        public void send(int channelId,
        byte[] data)
          throws IOException

        Send data to a remote Accessory Peer Agent. You must specify on which Service Channel to send data. For example, the Accessory Service Profile Protocol can specify two Service Channels in the Service Connection, one for commands and the other for data.

        Note: This method is a blocking call. It processes the byte array completely before returning. Do not send a byte array bigger than SAPeerAgent.getMaxAllowedDataSize(). Otherwise, the onError(int, String, int) callback is invoked.

        Parameters:
        channelId - The ID of the Service Channel for sending data, specified in the Accessory Application Protocol specification and declared in Accessory Service Profile XML file.
        data - The byte array of the data to be sent.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O-related error occurs while sending data.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if any argument is invalid.

      • secureSend

        public void secureSend(int channelId,
              byte[] data)
                throws IOException

        Send encrypted data to a remote Accessory Peer Agent. You must specify on which Service Channel to send data. For example, the Accessory Service Profile Protocol can specify two Service Channels in the Service Connection, one for commands and the other for data.

        Note: This method is a blocking call. It processes the byte array completely before returning. Do not send byte array bigger than SAPeerAgent.getMaxAllowedDataSize(). Otherwise, the onError(int, String, int) callback is invoked.

        Parameters:
        channelId - The ID of the Service Channel for sending data, specified in the Accessory Application Protocol specification and declared in Accessory Service Profile XML file.
        data - The byte array of the data to be sent
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O-related error occurs while sending data.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if any argument is invalid.

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the Service Connection with the remote Accessory Peer Agent. You can not reconnect to this Service Connection later, so a new Service Connection has to be established as needed. The Service Channels configured from the Accessory Service Profile XML during the Service Connection are considered to be closed once the service connection is closed.

        The SASocket is closed, and all Service Channels are lost.

      • onReceive

        public abstract void onReceive(int channelId,
             byte[] data)
        Called when data is received from the remote Accessory Peer Agent. Implement this method to handle the received data properly in order to realize the application's use cases.
        Parameters:
        channelId - The ID of the Service Channel on which the data is received.
        data - The byte array of the data received.

      • onError

        public abstract void onError(int channelId,
           String errorMessage,
           int errorCode)
        Called when an error occurs. Implement error handling mechanisms in this method.
        Parameters:
        channelId - The channel ID.
        errorMessage - The error message.
        errorCode - The error code.
        See Also:
        ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Get the status of the underlying Service Connection.
        Returns:

        true - if an active Service Connection exits to a remote SAPeerAgent.

        false - if the Service Connection has been terminated.
